body_html:
The right answer there is something like #8227.

This is more of an smaller ergonomics thing. I just want to be able to do data_format='NCHW' for e.g. tf.layers.conv2d, as is the case for most other things in TF, rather than having to do data_format='channels_first', which is the only supported scheme in tf.layers, and is not supported anywhere else in TF.

body:
The right answer there is something like https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/8227.

This is more of an smaller ergonomics thing. I just want to be able to do `data_format='NCHW'` for e.g. `tf.layers.conv2d`, as is the case for most other things in TF, rather than having to do `data_format='channels_first'`, which is the only supported scheme in `tf.layers`, and is not supported anywhere else in TF.
